name: Computer Science Mentors
description:
Computer Science Mentors (CSM) is the heart of the EECS/DS undergraduate teaching community. Our mission is twofold: we aim to provide undergraduates with the opportunity to teach, and we support students in lower division EECS/DS classes by hosting free small-group tutoring sections run by our mentors.

On the mentor side, CSM provides education on how to teach undergraduate level computer science. CSM's structure of senior and junior mentors allows mentors to receive feedback, practice teaching, and improve their teaching abilities over the course of each semester. A sizable portion of EECS/DS undergraduate course staff were once mentors in CSM, contributing to better quality of education for all Berkeley EECS/DS students. CSM hosts a variety of events including club-wide picnics, speaker events with EECS/DS faculty, mentor training sessions, and an end-of-semester banquet. These are held to help mentors to learn more about pedagogy and to form a community with other like-minded students.

On the mentee side, CSM's small-group sections help students receive personalized guidance in lower division EECS/DS classes despite huge class sizes and long office hours queues. In addition to weekly sections run by 250+ mentors, CSM holds exam review sessions and provides custom weekly worksheets for all of its courses. CSM’s tutoring sections help equalize access to resources and learning opportunities, especially for underrepresented groups.
summary: CSM offers an open and inclusive community space for students in computer science to receive individualized academic and social support. We coordinate various events, provide supplementary courses, and tutoring opportunities.
